availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William F. Coppage (Pendleton County, Kentucky, master carpenter)

body.p: Pendleton County, Kentucky, master carpenter. Pendleton County native. Married to Catharine M. Keith Coppage in Pendleton County, Kentucky, on September 9, 1852. Father of Georgia Ann Coppage, Albert L. Coppage, Mary E. Coppage, and Thomas E. Coppage. Owned one enslaved person in Pendleton County in 1850. Master carpenter in Pendleton County in 1860.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, District 1, p. 449.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, Falmouth, p. 437.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Pendleton County, p. 361A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records – Microfilm (1852-1910), KDLA, Roll #994052, Pendleton County Marriages, p. 1 of 20 of microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Find A Grave, “William F. Coppage (1829-1909)," Memorial # 47707078, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/47707078/william-f-coppage (accessed April 20, 2021).
